text: Coalition Change 2000 () was a political alliance in Costa Rica formed by the Alajuelense Democratic Action and United People. In the 2002 elections it failed to win a seat, whilst its candidate in the presidential election, Walter Coto Molina received only 0.2% of the vote.Nohlen, D (2005) Elections in the Americas: A data handbook, Volume I, p183 The coalition has since disappeared. ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in Costa Rica
title: Coalition Change 2000
